This is an Options question not an Execute Next Steps question. While it might be an interesting question, it will take you back several steps in the conversation and in a different direction.

The best question to ask at this point is, "If the administrative details can be overcome, what factors or criteria are most important to you when you consider trialing a product that you have never used before?"

This Execute Next Steps question moves you toward taking action and helps you to better understand the current situation.

Here is how Dr. Hayes would have answered that question:

"It must be efficacious and it must be safe. Those are the givens. After that, it should have good insurance coverage, be available at a reasonable cost, and shouldn’t be a hassle for my office to prescribe. Also, it must be significantly different from products I’m already prescribing – I won’t begin a new product just to have a new product."
